DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Web-Based Health Education Consultation Health Promotion Behaviors Adolescents
DOC.detailed_description: Background : Adolescent critical period many health-risk behaviour , alcohol consumption , smoking , unsafe sex , insufficient exercise , diet , psychological problem , reduce target web-based health education consultation intervention . Web-based intervention advantage term acceptability accessibility show study promote health behaviour e-Health literacy among adolescent . Objective : The aim study examine effectiveness web-based health education consultation health promotion behavior ( ie , smoking , health responsibility , nutrition , interpersonal relationship , spiritual health , alcohol substance abuse , positive life outlook , unsafe sex , malnutrition ) adolescents e-health literacy . Methods : This randomize control study consist 252 adolescent , 120 control group 132 comprise intervention group . Sociodemographic characteristic adolescent , internet usage , Adolescent Lifestyle Questionnaire ( ALQ ) , e-health literacy , information level adolescent determine intervention . No procedure apply control group . A web-based health education consultation program design promote healthy lifestyle apply intervention group . The result re-evaluated three month intervention . The investigator first hypothesis adolescent intervention ( web-based education consultation ) group would report significantly high level well-being ( ie , positive life outlook , stress management , spiritual health health-related quality life ) health behavior ( ie , health responsibility , nutrition , exercise ) 3-month follow-up compare control group . Second , expect participant intervention group would report significantly high level eHealth literacy knowledge 3-month follow-up compare control group .
